scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: Letter from Thomas Burke (December 20, 1778) sent from Philadelphia to an unnamed correspondent and discussing the withdrawal by Congress of two Continental currency issues (May 20, 1777 and April 11, 1778) from circulation because of British counterfeiting.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Thomas Burke (ca. 1747-1783) was a physician and lawyer. He served North Carolina as a delegate to the Continental Congress and as Governor.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
